ygData.subject: Re: Some ponderings about the fishing pole.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... All I know is this much, the fishing pole was given out by a GM (from what I ve read and been told). So it could have come from anywhere.
ygData.messageBody:
>From: sragan@...
>
>Hello Folks,
>
>After seeing all the different combinations that we have tried to no
> >avail, I'm beginning to think there might be a component somewhere >that
>we are not using. Looking on the 'Database'
> >(http://www.lockjaw.hamptoncity.com/recipe.html) I see that not many
> >combinations have been tried with the cork, sprocket, or cloth twine.
> >Although they dont seem to be the most likely candidates, I could see
> >them as a possibility.
>
>With all the misses, I just cant help thinking we have missed >something.
>
>I am also beginning to think that the earlier rumors of the fishing >pole
>being makable are bull shit. If someone is making the poles and >the eye
>glasses, I would have thought we would have heard about more >people having
>them. We have not heard a peep from anyone since. >Perhaps as Luke said,
>the pole was given as part of a GM quest, and >was not actually tinkered.
>
>I think it says something about the sad state of tinkering when >our >'holy
>grail' is a damn fishing pole =|
>
>Cheers,
>
>FizzWizz of tunare


All I know is this much, the fishing pole was given out by a GM (from what
I've read and been told). So it could have come from anywhere.
